titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the William Donovan scrapbook

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: William Donovan was born in Ann Arbor, Mich., in 1846, graduated from the University of Michigan as a civil engineer in 1865, worked for the Jackson, Lansing, and Saginaw Railroad. He was elected mayor of Lansing, Mich., in 1884, serving for two years. He was later associated with Lansing's water system and several railroads.
archdesc.scopecontent: Scrapbook mainly relating to Donovan's political activities, including clippings of speeches, election results, and reports, programs of meetings, and miscellanea.
